newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swissair lowers North America prices.
newsitem.headline: Swissair lowers North America prices.

text.p: Swissair, the flagship carrier in the SAirGroup, said it was cutting its fares to the United States by 15 to 20 percent from April 19 to match fares by its competitors.
Swissair said the new fares could be booked from April 19 until May 31. The tickes are valid for travel until October 31.
In the low season -- April 19 through May 31 and October 20 through October 31, fares to the East Cost of the U.S. are 860 Swiss francs and tickets to the West Coast 1,110 francs.
In the intermediate season -- June 1-30 and August 18-October 19 -- fares run between 960 and 1,230 francs.
High season fares to the U.S. cost 1,380 francs and up.
